title: Add pre-login attention pulse to Login button and smooth animations for username setup modal

requirements.text: Add a gentle looping attention animation to the Login button when the user is not authenticated (not logged in). The animation must subtly increase/decrease perceived brightness (e.g., via brightness/opacity/glow) in a smooth loop and must not run while the login flow is in progress ("Logging in...") or after the user is authenticated.

quotes: On the landing page, if the user is not logged in, make the login button gently pulse or “light up”, increasing and decreasing brightness slightly in a smooth loop.
Ensure this animation only occurs for users who haven’t logged in.

acceptanceCriteria: When identity is not present (unauthenticated), the Login button visibly but subtly pulses/brightens in a smooth loop.
When loginStatus is "logging-in", the attention animation is disabled and the button does not pulse.
When identity becomes present (authenticated), the Login button is replaced by the authenticated user menu (existing behavior) and no login attention animation is shown anywhere.

requirements.text: Add smooth entrance and exit animations to the username setup modal (ProfileSetupModal): when it opens after login it should fade/slide in smoothly, and when the username is successfully confirmed (profile saved and the modal closes due to existing gating logic), it should fade/slide out smoothly without abrupt disappearance.

quotes: After login, the username setup window should appear immediately but with a smooth fade-in/slide-in animation.
When the user types their username and confirms, the window should disappear immediately but smoothly, maintaining a polished transition.

acceptanceCriteria: When ProfileSetupModal transitions from closed to open (open={true}), the DialogContent animates in with a combined fade + slight slide (direction can be up or down).
When ProfileSetupModal transitions from open to closed (open={false}), the DialogContent animates out with a combined fade + slight slide, with no abrupt unmount/visual pop.
No changes to the modal’s functional behavior: it remains non-dismissable via outside click/escape as currently implemented, and continues to open/close based on existing setup gating logic.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn UI sources are read-only); implement animations via consumer component className usage, Tailwind config, and/or app-level CSS.
No backend behavior changes are requested; do not add or modify canister APIs for this work.
nonGoals: Do not redesign the overall header, navigation, or profile setup flow beyond adding the requested animations.
Do not introduce new authentication providers or change Internet Identity logic.
